channel.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
channel.description:
Alright, I sold an account for $100 to Gold4RS like a month ago. They sent me an e-mail about 10 minutes ago saying that my account was hacked, they failed to recover it with the information I gave them and that if I don't recover it in 24 hours they will refund the money (paid through PayPal). Don't they change the recoveries?
Luckily I had my e-mail still set on the account and recovered the account and changed the password.
What do I do now?
Do I send them the password back (or will they just say I didn't recover it or something and take my money back)? Do I keep my recovered account and let them file a dispute through PayPal (or will they recover it back after I do that with the information they already have)? Do I do the above and try and win the dispute?
I don't feel secure with any option...and this is not a buying debate, I know I should have tried a different site most likely.

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

They scammed me in the amount of $250.

Read full topic

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:79, topic:410174”][quote author=ultimatepkvillage link=topic=511457.msg3928234#msg3928234 date=1330435869]
gold4rs is a phishing scam site now. If you sell them anything they will say it got hacked just so they can refund the money they gave through paypal so basically they act as if the account was never sold told them & that they never got it which they do.
[/quote]if it’s true report it to their host[/quote]

I don’t use Gold4RS & never have, but I know how sites like those work

Read full topic

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

I applaud you for such a logical and well explained response!
Now for my two cents on the topic, I’ve read quite a few stories about them lately and it seems it depends on the person you talk to in their live chat on whether or not you’re going to be scammed.

Read full topic

[quote=“Acorn_, post:80, topic:410174”]Does nobody else see how old this post is? And why was my comment stating how old it was deleted?
I smell a trolling mod.[/quote]Possibly because there can still be logical discussion in this topic and there isn’t any need for this to be closed. Yes, the original post that gravedug this was deleted, along with others related to it, that way the topic can go on, possibly deterring any buying or selling here.

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @DannyC DannyC
item.description:
@DannyC wrote:

Gold4RS is actually legit. I’ve bought tons of shit from there.

,But there is a chance to get scammed. People work for Gold4RS, they give the gp to you. And get paid. But they can scam you,

1/100 chance of being scammed though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Yeah, I have the account and they have their money. It’s pretty much like nothing happened.

Anyone have experience with PlayerAuctions? I put it on there and someone sent me a reply tonight who is interested (it’s been up for 2-3 days).

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

Haha, just read through this whole thread. And to the claim Gold4Rs sent you, I would’ve replied back ‘Goodluck’. If they actually think they can get paypal to believe their story; (as I’m assuming they’ve had numerous other complaints from customers that are purchasing or selling Gold or an account.), I think a lot of people have forgotten that Gold4rs is an Illegal site, making it hilarious that they would even try to get their money back. Since you could definitively report them to paypal.

P.S; Sorry if I’m posting in an old topic and has probably already been resolved, but I just find most gold sites completely ridiculous.

Read full topic

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @DannyC DannyC
item.description:
@DannyC wrote:

It’s not Gold4RS no more, it’s gold4fun… They changed it as there’s a big chance Jagex will take over the domain. Not the databases etc though, dw about that.

Read full topic

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:71, topic:410174”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=511457.msg3742266#msg3742266 date=1315450122]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=511457.msg3742245#msg3742245 date=1315449332]

idk about that, i sold them my acc last month for $72 and recovered it later on, gg

Did you get charged back?
[/quote]i had them send the money to a random pp acc i made, then i bought rsgp with that money and closed the account

Can’t you get found out with that
[/quote]Probably, but you can (and will) also get banned for scamming here.

No. That’s ridiculous. Paypal/gold4rs deserves to loose money.[/quote]Excuse me? Nobody ‘deserves’ to lose money unless they gained it illegitimately themselves, and there’s already been discussion over at MITB saying that RWT isn’t against the law. I don’t like anyone that seems to think taking things from others is ok…

Read full topic

@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:61, topic:410174”]Alright I’m thinking of selling my level 124 account, they offered $100 dollars, it has 20m on it, 99 dungeon/range/str/98 hp/91 hunter.

I have no use for it as I’ve quit Runescape.

Now. Should I sell it?

I know its a pretty old topic.[/quote]

Haha wow, they offered me around that and my account had much higher stats. I wouldn’t mess with Gold4RS, you could try USFine, Sythe, playerauctions, etc.

item.title: Gold4RS: Account hacked
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

if gold4rs is a chinese based company, they probably have a hong kong based paypal account (due to currency exchanges and business licensing this is easiest for them). if that’s the case Paypal PLE is brutal to the seller when it comes to disputes (as chinese sellers tend to have many more disputes). its a virtual good. and it’s been some time since the transaction has completed. Let them open the dispute chances are paypal will side with you (the Customer)

Read full topic
